dishes.name: Pizza
procedure: Prepare the Dough: In a mixing bowl, combine 2 cups of all-purpose flour, 1 tablespoon of dry yeast, 1 teaspoon of sugar, 1 teaspoon of baking powder, and a pinch of salt. Gradually add water and 2 teaspoons of virgin olive oil to the dry ingredients, mixing until a dough forms. Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5-7 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic. Shape it into a ball.
Proof the Dough: Place the dough ball in a lightly oiled bowl, cover it with a clean kitchen towel or plastic wrap, and let it rest in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until it doubles in size.

Prepare the Toppings: Slice 1 tomato, 2 onions, 4 mushrooms, and 1/2 capsicum (green pepper). Grate 100 grams of processed cheese and 1/2 cup of mozzarella cheese and any other topppings of your choice.
Preheat the Oven: Preheat your oven to 220°C (425°F).
Roll Out the Dough: Once the dough has risen, punch it down to release any air bubbles. On a floured surface, roll out the dough into your desired pizza shape and thickness.

Assemble the Pizza: Transfer the rolled-out dough to a pizza stone or baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Spread 100 ml of tomato ketchup evenly over the dough. Arrange the sliced tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, and capsicum on top of the sauce. Sprinkle the grated processed cheese and mozzarella cheese over the vegetables. Season with 1 teaspoon of chili flakes and 1 teaspoon of oregano.
Bake the Pizza: Place the assembled pizza in the preheated oven. Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve: Once baked, remove the pizza from the oven. Slice the pizza into wedges and serve hot with additional toppings or accompaniments as desired.

dishes.name: Pasta
procedure: Cook the pasta: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Make the sauce: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and chopped onion, and cook until softened and fragrant, about 2-3 minutes.

Add the diced tomatoes (with their juices), dried basil, and dried oregano to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer the sauce for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until slightly thickened.
Combine the pasta and sauce: Add the cooked pasta to the skillet with the sauce. Toss everything together until the pasta is evenly coated with the sauce.
Serve: Divide the pasta among serving plates. Sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese and serve hot, accompanied by garlic bread.

dishes.name: Lasgna
procedure: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Cook the lasagna noodles according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Make the meat sauce: In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and cook until the onion is softened and translucent.
Add the crushed tomatoes, tomato sauce, dried basil, and dried oregano to the skillet. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Simmer the sauce for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
In a separate bowl, combine the ricotta cheese, egg, and grated Parmesan cheese. Mix well.

Assemble the lasagna: Spread a thin layer of meat sauce on the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Arrange 3 lasagna noodles on top. Spread half of the ricotta cheese mixture over the noodles, followed by a layer of meat sauce and shredded mozzarella cheese.
Repeat the layers with the remaining ingredients, ending with a layer of shredded mozzarella cheese on top.
Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
Remove the foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
Let the lasagna cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving. Enjoy!

dishes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
procedure: Cook the spaghetti: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain, reserving 1 cup of pasta water, and set aside.
In a large skillet, cook the diced pancetta or bacon over medium heat until crispy. Remove from the skillet and drain on paper towels, reserving some of the fat in the skillet.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs and grated Parmesan cheese until well combined. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
In the same skillet with the reserved fat, add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the skillet with the garlic and toss to coat, adding some of the reserved pasta water if needed to loosen the pasta.

Remove the skillet from the heat and quickly stir in the egg and cheese mixture, tossing continuously to coat the spaghetti evenly. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs and create a creamy sauce.
Return the crispy pancetta or bacon to the skillet and toss to combine with the spaghetti.
Serve the spaghetti carbonara hot, garnished with chopped fresh parsley and additional grated Parmesan cheese if desired. Enjoy!

dishes.name: Tiramisu
ingredients: 2 tablespoons unsweetened cocoa powder, for dusting
procedure: In a mixing bowl, beat the egg yolks with 1/2 cup of granulated sugar until pale and thick. Add the mascarpone cheese and vanilla extract, and beat until smooth and creamy.
In a separate mixing bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. Gently fold the beaten egg whites into the mascarpone mixture until well combined.

In a shallow dish, combine the cooled brewed coffee and coffee liqueur (if using). Dip each ladyfinger cookie into the coffee mixture, turning to coat both sides, but do not soak them too long or they will become soggy.
Arrange a layer of dipped ladyfingers in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish or a similar-sized serving dish.
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the layer of ladyfingers. Repeat with another layer of dipped ladyfingers and the remaining mascarpone mixture.
Cover the dish with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or preferably overnight, to allow the flavors to meld and the tiramisu to set.
Before serving, dust the top of the tiramisu with unsweetened cocoa powder using a fine-mesh sieve.
Slice and serve the tiramisu chilled, and enjoy the creamy, coffee-infused dessert!

dishes.name: Sushi
ingredients: Assorted fillings (such as cucumber, avocado, crab sticks, smoked salmon, tuna, etc.)
Soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger for serving
procedure: Prepare the sushi rice: Rinse the sushi rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Combine the rice and water in a rice cooker or pot and cook according to the package instructions. In a small saucepan, heat the rice vinegar, sugar, and salt over low heat until the sugar and salt dissolve. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly. Once the rice is cooked, transfer it to a large bowl and gently fold in the vinegar mixture until well combined. Allow the rice to cool to room temperature.
Prepare the fillings: Slice the cucumber, avocado, crab sticks, smoked salmon, tuna, or any other desired fillings into thin strips.

Assemble the sushi rolls: Place a sheet of nori seaweed on a bamboo sushi mat or a clean kitchen towel. With wet hands, spread a thin layer of sushi rice evenly over the nori, leaving about 1 inch of space at the top edge. Arrange the desired fillings in a line across the bottom third of the rice-covered nori.

Roll the sushi: Lift the edge of the bamboo mat closest to you and begin rolling the sushi away from you, using the mat to shape the roll. Apply gentle pressure to compact the roll as you go. Once rolled, moisten the top edge of the nori with a bit of water to seal the roll.
Slice the sushi rolls: Use a sharp knife to slice the sushi roll into individual pieces, wiping the knife with a damp cloth between cuts to keep it clean.
Serve the sushi: Arrange the sliced sushi on a serving platter and serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger on the side. Enjoy your homemade sushi!

dishes.name: Ramen
ingredients: 1 cup sliced bok choy or spinach
1/2 cup sliced cooked pork or chicken (optional)
procedure: In a large pot, heat the sesame oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger, and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the chicken or vegetable broth to the pot and bring to a simmer. Stir in the soy sauce and miso paste until well combined.

Add the sliced mushrooms, bok choy or spinach, and optional bamboo shoots and sliced meat (if using) to the pot. Simmer for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender and the meat is heated through.
Meanwhile, cook the ramen noodles according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process.
Divide the cooked noodles among serving bowls. Ladle the hot broth and vegetables over the noodles.
Garnish each bowl with chopped green onions, a halved boiled egg, and a sheet of nori seaweed. Serve hot and enjoy your delicious homemade ramen!

dishes.name: Udon
ingredients: 1 sheet nori seaweed, cut into thin strips
procedure: In a large pot, combine the dashi stock (or vegetable broth), soy sauce, mirin, sake (if using), and sugar. Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Add the sliced shiitake mushrooms, carrots, and bamboo shoots to the pot. Simmer for about 5 minutes until the vegetables are tender.
Meanwhile, cook the udon noodles according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process.
Divide the cooked udon noodles among serving bowls.
Ladle the hot broth and vegetables over the noodles.
Garnish each bowl with sliced green onions, nori seaweed strips, and optionally a halved boiled egg.
Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds over the top for extra flavor.
Serve hot and enjoy your comforting bowl of homemade udon!

dishes.name: Soba
ingredients: 1 sheet nori seaweed, cut into thin strips (optional)
procedure: In a large pot, bring the water to a boil over high heat.
Add the soba noodles to the boiling water and cook according to the package instructions until al dente, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.

While the soba noodles are cooking, prepare the dipping sauce: In a small saucepan, combine the soy sauce, mirin, sake (if using), and sugar. Heat over medium heat until the sugar is dissolved and the sauce is heated through. Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Once the soba noodles are cooked, drain them in a colander and rinse under cold water to stop the cooking process and remove excess starch.
Divide the cooked soba noodles among serving bowls or plates.
Serve the soba noodles with the dipping sauce on the side.
Garnish each serving with sliced green onions, nori seaweed strips, wasabi paste, grated daikon radish, and toasted sesame seeds as desired.
To eat, take a small amount of soba noodles with your chopsticks and dip them into the dipping sauce. Enjoy your delicious and refreshing bowl of homemade soba!

dishes.name: Ratatouille
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Fresh basil leaves, chopped, for garnish
procedure: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
In a large baking dish, combine the diced eggplant, zucchinis, bell peppers, tomatoes, onion, and minced garlic.
Drizzle olive oil over the vegetables and toss to coat evenly. Season with salt, black pepper, dried thyme, and dried oregano. Mix well.
Dollop tomato paste over the vegetables and gently stir to incorporate.
Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and cooked through.
Once cooked, remove the foil and continue baking for an additional 10-15 minutes to allow the excess moisture to evaporate and the flavors to concentrate.
Remove the ratatouille from the oven and let it cool slightly before serving.
Garnish with chopped fresh basil leaves before serving. Serve hot or at room temperature with crusty bread. Enjoy your homemade ratatouille!

dishes.name: Steak au Poivre
ingredients: 4 beef tenderloin steaks, about 1 inch thick
procedure: Season the beef tenderloin steaks generously with salt on both sides.
Coat the steaks evenly with the crushed black peppercorns, pressing them into the meat to adhere.
In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat until shimmering but not smoking.

Add the seasoned steaks to the skillet and cook for about 4-5 minutes on each side for medium-rare, or until cooked to your desired doneness. Remove the steaks from the skillet and transfer them to a plate. Tent loosely with foil to keep warm.
Reduce the heat to medium and add the unsalted butter to the skillet. Once melted, add the beef broth and brandy or cognac, stirring to scrape up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet.
Simmer the sauce for a few minutes until slightly reduced, then stir in the heavy cream. Continue to simmer for another 2-3 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly.
Return the cooked steaks to the skillet and spoon the sauce over them. Cook for another minute or two, allowing the steaks to heat through and the flavors to meld.

Transfer the steaks to serving plates, spooning any remaining sauce over the top. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve hot, accompanied by mashed potatoes and green beans. Enjoy your delicious Steak au Poivre!

dishes.name: Baguette
procedure: In a large mixing bowl, combine the bread flour and salt.
In a separate small bowl, mix the instant yeast with lukewarm water and let it sit for a few minutes until foamy.
Pour the yeast mixture into the flour mixture and stir until a dough starts to form.
Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead it for about 10-15 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic.

Shape the dough into a ball and place it in a lightly greased bowl. Cover the bowl with a clean kitchen towel or plastic wrap and let the dough rise in a warm place for about 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.
Punch down the risen dough to release any air bubbles. Transfer it to a lightly floured surface and divide it into two equal portions.
Shape each portion into a long baguette shape, about 14-16 inches long, and place them on a lightly floured baking sheet or a baguette pan.
Cover the shaped baguettes with a clean kitchen towel and let them rise for another 30-60 minutes, or until puffy.
Preheat your oven to 220°C (425°F).
Using a sharp knife or a bread lame, make diagonal slashes along the tops of the risen baguettes.
Bake the baguettes in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown and crispy.
Remove the baguettes from the oven and let them cool on a wire rack before slicing and serving. Enjoy your homemade baguettes with butter, cheese, or jam!

dishes.name: Pot-au-fue
ingredients: 2 pounds beef chuck roast, cut into large chunks
4 carrots, peeled and cut into large chunks
4 celery stalks, cut into large chunks
procedure: In a large stockpot, combine the beef chuck roast, beef marrow bones, carrots, celery, onions, garlic, leek, bay leaves, and black peppercorns.
Add enough water to cover the ingredients by about 2 inches. Season with salt to taste.
Bring the pot to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to low and simmer, partially covered, for about 3-4 hours, or until the meat is tender and the flavors have melded.
Skim off any foam or impurities that rise to the surface during cooking.
Once cooked, remove the beef chuck roast and marrow bones from the pot and transfer them to a cutting board. Let them rest for a few minutes before slicing the beef.
Strain the broth through a fine-mesh sieve into a separate large bowl, discarding the solids. Return the strained broth to the pot.
To serve, ladle the hot broth into serving bowls. Arrange slices of the cooked beef chuck roast on top of the broth. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Serve the Pot-au-Feu hot, accompanied by crusty bread and Dijon mustard. Enjoy the comforting and hearty flavors of this classic French dish!

dishes.name: Tacos al Pastor
dishes.accompaniment: salsa verde, chopped onions, cilantro, lime wedges
ingredients: 4 dried guajillo chilies, stemmed and seeded
2 dried ancho chilies, stemmed and seeded
Salt and black pepper to taste
procedure: In a blender, combine the dried guajillo chilies, dried ancho chilies, chopped onion, minced garlic, white vinegar, dried oregano, ground cumin, smoked paprika, ground cloves, salt, and black pepper. Blend until smooth to make the marinade.
In a large bowl, toss the thinly sliced pork shoulder with the marinade until evenly coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or overnight, to marinate.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill the marinated pork slices for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until charred and cooked through.
Remove the grilled pork from the heat and let it rest for a few minutes before slicing it into smaller pieces.
To serve, warm the corn tortillas and fill them with the sliced grilled pork. Top with salsa verde, chopped onions, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime juice. Enjoy your flavorful Tacos al Pastor!

dishes.name: Chiles Rellenos
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
procedure: Roast the poblano peppers over an open flame or under the broiler until the skins are charred and blistered. Place them in a bowl, cover with plastic wrap, and let them steam for about 10 minutes.
Carefully peel off the charred skins from the roasted poblano peppers, leaving the stems intact. Make a lengthwise slit in each pepper and remove the seeds and membranes.
In a mixing bowl, combine the shredded Oaxaca cheese and cooked shredded chicken. Stuff each poblano pepper with the cheese and chicken mixture, being careful not to overfill.
In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites until stiff peaks form. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks until pale and frothy.
Gently fold the beaten egg yolks into the stiff egg whites until just combined to make the batter.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dredge each stuffed poblano pepper in all-purpose flour, then dip it into the egg batter to coat evenly.
Fry the battered poblano peppers in the hot oil until golden brown and crispy on all sides, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
In a separate saucepan, heat a little vegetable oil over medium heat. Sauté the finely chopped onion and minced garlic until softened.
Stir in the tomato sauce, ground cumin, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper. Simmer the sauce for a few minutes until heated through.
To serve, spoon the tomato sauce over the fried chiles rellenos. Serve hot with rice and refried beans. Enjoy your delicious Chiles Rellenos!

dishes.name: Mole Poblano
ingredients: 4 dried ancho chilies, stemmed and seeded
4 dried pasilla chilies, stemmed and seeded
2 dried guajillo chilies, stemmed and seeded
Salt and black pepper to taste
procedure: In a dry skillet over medium heat, toast the dried ancho chilies, dried pasilla chilies, and dried guajillo chilies for a few minutes until fragrant. Transfer them to a bowl and cover with hot water. Let them soak for about 20 minutes to soften.
In the same skillet, toast the raisins and sesame seeds until golden brown. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
Heat vegetable oil in the skillet over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until softened.
Add the chopped tomatoes, slivered almonds, unsweetened cocoa powder, ground cinnamon, ground cloves, and ground coriander to the skillet. Cook for a few minutes until the tomatoes are softened.
Transfer the toasted chilies, raisins, sesame seeds, onion mixture, and chicken or vegetable broth to a blender. Blend until smooth to make the mole sauce.
Return the blended mole sauce to the skillet. Season with salt, black pepper, and sugar (if using) to taste.
Simmer the mole sauce over low heat for about 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened and the flavors have melded.
To serve, ladle the warm mole sauce over cooked chicken, turkey, or pork. Serve with rice and tortillas. Enjoy the rich and complex flavors of Mole Poblano!

dishes.name: Enchiladas Verdes
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Sliced avocado and additional chopped cilantro for garnish
procedure: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a skillet over medium heat, warm the salsa verde until heated through.
Spread a small amount of salsa verde in the bottom of a baking dish.
In a separate skillet, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Quickly fry each corn tortilla for a few seconds on each side until softened. Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil.
In a mixing bowl, combine the shredded cooked chicken, sour cream, chopped fresh cilantro, and half of the shredded Monterey Jack cheese. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Spoon a portion of the chicken mixture onto each softened corn tortilla and roll it up tightly. Place the rolled enchiladas seam-side down in the prepared baking dish.
Pour the remaining salsa verde over the top of the enchiladas, spreading it evenly.
Sprinkle the remaining shredded Monterey Jack cheese over the top of the enchiladas.
Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove the foil and continue baking for another 5-10 minutes until the cheese is golden brown.
Serve the hot enchiladas verdes garnished with sliced avocado and additional chopped cilantro. Enjoy your flavorful and comforting meal!

dishes.name: Spanakopita
ingredients: 1 pound fresh spinach, washed and chopped
Salt and black pepper to taste
procedure: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine the spinach, dill, parsley, green onions, feta cheese, and beaten eggs. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Brush a baking dish with olive oil or melted butter.
Lay a sheet of phyllo dough in the baking dish and brush it with melted butter. Continue layering phyllo sheets and brushing with butter until you have 6-7 layers.
Spread the spinach and feta mixture evenly over the phyllo layers.
Continue layering phyllo sheets and brushing with butter until you have another 6-7 layers on top.
Trim the edges of the phyllo dough and score the top into diamond-shaped pieces.
Bake in the preheated oven for 30-35 minutes, or until the phyllo is golden brown and crisp.
Remove from the oven and let it cool slightly before cutting into pieces.
Serve the spanakopita with a Greek salad and tzatziki sauce for dipping.

dishes.name: Tteokbokki
procedure: In a large saucepan, combine the gochujang, gochugaru, soy sauce, sugar, minced garlic, and water. Stir to mix.
Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for a few minutes.
Add the rice cakes to the saucepan and cook for 5-7 minutes until they become soft and tender.
Add the fish cakes and cook for another 2-3 minutes until heated through.
Stir in the sliced green onions and continue to cook for another minute.
Transfer the tteokbokki to a serving dish and garnish with sesame seeds.
Serve with steamed rice and kimchi for a complete meal.

dishes.name: Fattoush
dishes.accompaniment: Pita bread, grilled chicken or lamb
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
procedure: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Cut the pita bread into bite-sized pieces and spread them on a baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 minutes until crisp and golden brown.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the cucumber, tomatoes, green bell pepper, red onion, parsley, and mint.
Add the olive oil, lemon juice, sumac, salt, and black pepper. Mix well to combine.
Add the toasted pita bread pieces to the salad just before serving, and toss to combine.
Serve the fattoush as a refreshing side dish or as an accompaniment to grilled meats.
